website_summaries.verdict: These large shears with a blunt tip are low in cost and an excellent addition to the medic's bag.

customer_reviews.title: NOT titanium...why must they lie??
customer_reviews.text: Do they work? Yes. Are they a good price for the money? Yes. Did I return them? No, I kept them because they work. But they are NOT titanium. Ridiculous lie right in the title, and in all the descriptions. Titanium is non-magnetic. If a magnet sticks to a piece of metal, it’s steel. A magnet sticks to these. (Not to mention the price would have to be around $45 to be Ti.) But as I said above, these do work and they seem to be a non-branded version identical to the popular Madison Supply ones, at half the cost. But the marketing lie still bothers me...
customer_reviews.author: DC

customer_reviews.title: This is disgusting. Pictures are how it looked straight out of ...
customer_reviews.text: Got an used (or probably returned) product. Since this sort of scissor is mainly used for medical purposes, this could have been used on blood/drainage/other nasty (or infectious) stuffs. This is disgusting. Pictures are how it looked straight out of packaging. I didn’t use it one bit.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Two out of two defective
customer_reviews.text: The first one received was defective. The tab at the end of the bottom jaw should be bent 90 degrees so that it is perpendicular to the blades and will lay flat against the skin. You can see this in the images the seller provided. But on the one received it was only bent about 15 degrees. This makes the lower blade very thick, which will make it difficult to get under bandages. So I sent it back and quickly received a replacement. It had the exact same defect. Sending this one back for a refund. Too bad. Other than that it was just what I wanted.
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for. Solid affordable, 3 star product
customer_reviews.text: ER nurse here. If you want a functional, cheap and replaceable pair of shears, these are adequate. I have successfully used them in code situations to cut patient's clothes without difficulty. They are not perfect, the alignment between the blades could be more snug, and the handle is extremely hard -- can be painful on the grip when cutting through thick material. If you want to overpay for top-tier minor accessories, look elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: John Smilk

customer_reviews.title: A nurses review!
customer_reviews.text: These are really nice! They work great! I'm a nurse so I don't use them like a medic or anything like that. The color is point on. Looks exactly like the image provided. My only problem with them and again it's because I don't use them as someone like a medic would, is that they are heavier than I would like and bulky. But if you have scrub pants with leg side pockets they are perfect placed there! But when I have them in my scrub top pockets it just feels too heavy and bulky! Product works great!! 4/5 stars just for the issues above!
customer_reviews.author: Felishia Donaldson

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality but cuts
customer_reviews.text: Just had my scissors delivered and first thing I noticed was what appears to be plastic or paper bonded into the grip where the metal is held in place. The second thing I noticed is what appeared to be wear on the scissors, turns out the coating rubs off with just your fingers. However, it did cut the plastic bag that it came in without a problem. Spend an extra $3-$4 and get a well manufactured and good quality pair of shears... wish I would’ve read the comments before purchasing.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Worst value ever!
customer_reviews.text: Worst value ever! But this is the occasional paper, single sheet. Once in a while trimming the bandage to fit. Unfortunately, black paint wore off about two months after my purchase. Scissors got rusty, And are extremely difficult to use. The rust is red in color, meaning that ot contained a lot of iron. Also, titanium if it corrodes, should look like aluminum, gray or white, not red!. So these were regular steel scissors covered in black paint, as far as I can see.. Really misleading product description. I have purchased stainless steel scissors before, and have never had this kind of problem. Same price.
customer_reviews.author: eth

customer_reviews.title: These things cut
customer_reviews.text: These are great shears for the money. I put one in my personal blowout kit and one with my vehicle based first aid kit. They will cut a penny in half and still cut gauze, jeans or leather. Because they are all black they are tacticool.
customer_reviews.author: Omegaman

customer_reviews.title: They’ve survived 6 months in my ER, not bad.
customer_reviews.text: So I bought two of these, I’m still using the first pair. A little background on me, I’m an ER nurse in the busiest hospital of the lower half of my state. These have cut through a few overalls and leather boots. Still using them. There is a little more play to them than at first. This tells me eventually they will wear out, but for the price you can’t beat them. Need a good pair of trauma shears, these will do the job.
customer_reviews.author: Attila C

customer_reviews.title: NOT Titanium
customer_reviews.text: They work for what they're intended to do. I gave one star because they claim to be "bonded titanium". However, as other reviews have mentioned, these are magnetic. Titanium is not magnetic. Only ferrous (iron-based) metals are magnetic. I've had them for three years and there is no indication of rust, so they are probably some form of stainless steel. However, because the seller(s) / manufacturer are lying about them being titanium, it's hard to tell what kind of. If they are stainless they are probably a 304 SS, which is decent. 316 is much better, but is also non-magnetic secondary to how the atoms are arranged. So, they aren't "the best" of steel if they are steel at all.
customer_reviews.author: GG

customer_reviews.title: We fixed that and now they cut great. I use them at home
customer_reviews.text: The bandage scissors work well, They are sharp enough to cut through several layers of gauze and tape. The screw holding the blades together was a little tight at first, making the scissors too stiff. We fixed that and now they cut great. I use them at home, so I don't need to autoclave them, just sanitize with rubbing alcohol.
customer_reviews.author: Juin TeVrucht

customer_reviews.title: Happy customer
customer_reviews.text: I don't want to risk cutting a penny with them, I am sure they could handle it but I don't want to dull them. I did cut credit cards with ease, no binding or hiccups, not bending like cheap flimsy pairs I have used. Used them on scrap denim and t-shirts too. Seem sharp and sturdy, they live in my reebow tactical IFAK now.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: Barely cut through two layers of gauze
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed. These were the first pair of shears for me, as I am a nursing student. These could barely cut through two layers of gauze.
customer_reviews.author: Susanmarie

customer_reviews.title: Not high quality, but a good value
customer_reviews.text: I use these with horses with leg wounds. My gloves are size Women's Large so I don't have dainty hands . . . but not that huge. The bottom ring is too small for my fingers - kinda uncomfortable to use them. They do not cut as easily or smoothly as the good stainless steel bandage scissors. However, they are cheaper. I'd call these a good value for your backup bandage scissors. As often as I lose these things, a good price is important to me! I'll keep them and use them.
customer_reviews.author: OutWest

customer_reviews.title: These things are awesome
customer_reviews.text: I've never had to use them for their intended purpose, I keep them with my med kit. However I find myself using them frequently to cut cotton for my vaping device, I've tried a lot of scissors and it would cut some and some strands would just bend around the blade, this thing slices through fluffy cotton like a knife through warm butter. I will note: These do rust, I'd recommend oiling them every so often just a light coating, like you'd do to a firearm. maybe froglube or something along those lines would suit you well
customer_reviews.author: Michael M.

customer_reviews.title: FLIMSY SCISSORS DISSAPOINTED
customer_reviews.text: Picked these up as a replacement set for a "Robust" older pair I have that I use every day for cutting paracord and thick plastic (1/6"). THESE ARE NOT MADE FOR HEAVY DUTY USE AND THE SCISSORS SEPARATE WHEN TRYING TO CUT THICK OBJECTS. At best these scissors are good for thick paper, MAYBE cardboard. You get what you pay for I suppose. At this price they are not even worth sending back. I will throw them in a junk drawer and use them for paper or to open packages with.
customer_reviews.author: NTODWILD

customer_reviews.title: Piss poor
customer_reviews.text: I had been a medic for aong time so I used this type of trauma shears often. I've literally seen them cut pennies. Sadly these shears are piss poor. I used them one time to cut a bandage and like most EMS professionals used them for household task like cutting Christmas wrapping paper. They FAILED the objective. I felt like I was cutting the paper with kindergarten scissors.
customer_reviews.author: Jared A. Lang

customer_reviews.title: For the cost they can’t be beat.
customer_reviews.text: Are these the best? No. Would you find these in an American ER defiantly not. Will they cut through clothing and bandages in and emergency situation? Heck yes they will. I will say they are a bit “unpolished” and large, but are great in a chest rig or truck first aid/ emergency kit. I would buy again. I hope this review was helpful.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher

customer_reviews.title: The best I've ever owned
customer_reviews.text: I've been buying and using shears like these for decades. These are easily the best purpose built shears I've owned. They will cut through just about anything that will fit inside the jaws. Even though they don't have some of the gimmicks of higher priced offerings (glass breaker, seat belt cutters, bottle openers) they do what they were designed for well and at a reasonable cost.
customer_reviews.author: Weezill

customer_reviews.title: Keep it close!
customer_reviews.text: My coworkers are ALWAYS picking up mine saying “dang! I love the black”. Better watch out, these are not only cute but gets the job done. I swear one day someone will snatch these if I set them down for too long! Cuts clothes, bandages, paperclips... yes I said paperclips. I had some lady pick up my scissors to cut a paperclip (well it worked but I wasn’t happy!) you’ll love them!
customer_reviews.author: Emily

customer_reviews.title: Safe
customer_reviews.text: I think someone still uses these to cut bracelets off at a clinic, I had to buy because I borrowed some from the front desk that had highlighter ink on the blade, but resembled blood at first glance, very embarrassing. Get your own scissors if your going to use with patients, and these are stab safe, so you can remove bandages without scraping skin
customer_reviews.author: Bill68

customer_reviews.title: Exactly item required
customer_reviews.text: Required safe, effective,shears for office all around use, such as opening Amazon packages. Feel nice in hand, lite but strong, sharp yet safe, attractive black uniform with other office tools. Quite happy with order
customer_reviews.author: Republica Peruanu

customer_reviews.title: Paramedic / EMT scissors
customer_reviews.text: Designed to safely cut clothing from trauma victims. I've been using to remove tape from my broken ankle. Design of one blade allows blade to slide between skin and tape. Excellent - sharp, good design, plenty of leverage. MANY non-medical uses as well.
customer_reviews.author: RK

customer_reviews.title: Cuts jeans, cast padding with ease
customer_reviews.text: I'm an E.R. nurse, so I've definitely gotten some mileage out of these. Right out the box, they're super sharp, and with about 7 months of regular use, they don't seem to have dulled much at all. From t-shirts, to denim, to thick splint padding, these can handle it. And they're about 1/3rd the price you would pay at a nursing uniform store.
customer_reviews.author: RDU86

customer_reviews.title: Quality as expected
customer_reviews.text: I wanted these for a go-bag, and I am not disappointed. I am tired if seeing the cheap stuff made to save money instead of providing a service. I like that these are dark grey and not stainless. They are strong and won't bend. It reads "titanium" but I think of these were real titanium they would cost much more, so not too sure about this. But it's a solid item.
customer_reviews.author: R. McLaughlin

customer_reviews.title: doesn't cut very well
customer_reviews.text: The shipping on these shears was lightning fast, however these shears do not feel good in the hand as they pinch my palm, and they twist when you attempt to cut through materials. these shears can cut through cheap, thin cloth just fine.... but if you need to cut something not made in china; think again. try another set of shears and drop me a message. I'm always on the look out for filling my tool box with new and useful items.
customer_reviews.author: Tyrome Francisco

customer_reviews.title: Sharp and lightweight
customer_reviews.text: Feels a little flimsy but it is nice because they are lightweight and get the job done. I am a nurse tech and I always have a ton of things in my pocket so having lightweight scissors that are also affordable in case I lose them (which is a given) makes it a plus! I would recommend these. They are sharp.
customer_reviews.author: David Stolz

customer_reviews.title: Awesome shears
customer_reviews.text: These are super strong shears. I love the review complaining that they're not made of titanium... Why would would you want titanium shears? It's softer than steel so you'd have to sharpen them every time you cut something hard. Hilarious. These are great shears and we have 2 pairs we use daily on tough materials.
customer_reviews.author: 1a

customer_reviews.title: Great quality!
customer_reviews.text: Very high quality! I used it for a year now, cutting bandages, suction tubing, tape, gowns, etc. everyday and it still cuts great! I keep it on me all the time and would definitely order again if I lose the one I have now.
customer_reviews.author: Forest Room

customer_reviews.title: scissors
customer_reviews.text: Scissors appear to be just fine. Placed them in first aid kits, one in house and the other in my car. Have not tried to cut any thing with them but am sure that if the time comes they will do just great. Great price and arrived in just a couple of days from purchase date. Satisfied with everything concerning the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Wallace Lockhart

customer_reviews.title: Might not be the cheapest but they’re the best for the price range
customer_reviews.text: These cut clothing and bandage material really well....almost as well as the far more expensive leatherman shears. These solid shears for the money and the black anodized coating seems reasonably durable and is not coming off after multiple disinfectant wipe uses.
customer_reviews.author: Bartleby

customer_reviews.title: Great Value
customer_reviews.text: I have a condition with my legs where they have to be wrapped to catch the drainage and when I need to change the wrapping I needed a safe way to cut the old ones off. Regular scissors are sharp pointed and I poked myself several times. These are blunt and can’t poke me. Great value they are built for continuous use by paramedics, nurses, ambulance attendants, and look like they will stand the test of time.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Clark

customer_reviews.title: Use it every shift!
customer_reviews.text: I work as an emergency room technician, and I use my shears to cut clothes, fiberglass, gauze, and just about everything else in the ER. I've had these shears for months and they are still as sharp as when I first bought them. The color is not fading and I will buy these shears again.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Hoil

customer_reviews.title: Too much blade flex
customer_reviews.text: Should work okay, but will require more effort to cut thicker clothing as the blades have much more flex in them than my other "titanium" shears. Having a hard time with shears is something that is very frustrating in an emergency, so I returned these.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Well made usefully light under 7 bucks
customer_reviews.text: I needed shop shears saw these gave them a try and was I surprised they cut through all the things I've needed in house and garage wow and for under 7 dollars I'm beside myself get one for every day use and cuts a penny in half 😀
customer_reviews.author: Dale

customer_reviews.title: Good Shears
customer_reviews.text: We bought these to keep in our doggy first-aid kit. They work great for cutting vet wrap, tape and loads of other stuff. The safety tips are nice for sliding under bandages to cut them away without worrying about injury the "patient". A great pair of shear to keep in your kit.
customer_reviews.author: Run2Swim

customer_reviews.title: Trauma shears
customer_reviews.text: These are great shears, but they will never be as sharp as the bandage scissors in the OR (where I work). For that reason, I no longer use these, but for medical professionals who don’t have access to surgical instruments, these are great.
customer_reviews.author: Christa

customer_reviews.title: Literal Lifesaver
customer_reviews.text: As a Respiratory Therapist, these are a daily use item for me at work. They have lasted the test of time and are a literal lifesaver. Over two years they have lost a tiny amount of their black from wiping them with alcohol so much, but I feel the wear just shows their good usage.
customer_reviews.author: Adrian

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality
customer_reviews.text: The tab at the end of the blade is not bent at 90 degrees, more like 45 degrees. If I were using for bandage shears, it would be less effective. The blade is only about 2 1/2 inches. The metal is quite hard and I was unable to bend the tab. As I am using for utility shears, they will do.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas47

customer_reviews.title: Black coloring easily rubs off one of the blades and is starting ...
customer_reviews.text: Black coloring easily rubs off one of the blades and is starting to wear on the other. Keep in mind that I have had these shears only about a week and haven't used them. All I have done is slide them in and out of the carrying pouch a few times to check for fit. It looks as if someone simply used a black marker on the stainless blades to make them appear black.
customer_reviews.author: David A. Kelsey

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful value
customer_reviews.text: Bought this pair for my clinical. Great product if you are working in ED or trauma. Durable and effective. I advise to get a clip for them. Can get bulky carrying in the pocket
customer_reviews.author: Alina

customer_reviews.title: Use this to replace the crappy shears that come in store-bought first aid kits!
customer_reviews.text: These are good, sturdy, reuseable shears. I have three IFAK/trauma kits, one in the truck, one in the go-bag, and one in the house. This is a must-have item. Build your own kits people! The shears they pack in the first aid kits from Walmart/Target are crap. Be prepared!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Throw it in your mobile med kit!
customer_reviews.text: Got these to throw into the meek it that I made to keep in my car. Love the black color and they feel as sturdy as you can except for something that costs about $7. But cant beat the price.
customer_reviews.author: jusdavidtin

customer_reviews.title: Function but defective and large
customer_reviews.text: They cut a penny so I'm assuming they work in clothes, have yet to try. BUT, serated part of shears is bent and does not allow the shears to open and close properly. Plus, like other reviews, the finger holes are quite large. WOULD not recommend for women or men with smaller hands.
customer_reviews.author: Steven Ruiz

customer_reviews.title: The perfect medical scissors for any nurse
customer_reviews.text: I am an ER nurse and have been carrying these scissors for over a year. They are amazing! I never use any other scissors we have in the ER becuase these simply are the best. Very sleek design as well. Great for many uses in patient care including cutting bandages, tape, and just about anything else you might need to cut while at work. Easy to clean. Fits well in scrub pocket. If I ever lose this pair I will come straight back here to Amazon and buy them again. More than worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel

customer_reviews.title: Super strong
customer_reviews.text: I have no doubt these could cut a penny or ring if I tried. The blades are super strong and sharp, with very good contact between the blades and no wiggle. It cuts through thick fabric like denim like it's paper.
customer_reviews.author: Steven

customer_reviews.title: useless
customer_reviews.text: useless scissors. not sharp. serration makes them very hard to use
customer_reviews.author: jk

customer_reviews.title: Good scissor. I bought this kind of scissor in ...
customer_reviews.text: Good scissor. I bought this kind of scissor in store the stainless steel and I may be be I should try the titanium one because it’s lighter and I hope it will last longer than the one I have before.
customer_reviews.author: Nestor L

customer_reviews.title: Great Bandage shears...they are a cut above!
customer_reviews.text: These shears are great! We are using them for bandage removal and they cut right through the old bandages with no problem or worry about harming the patient. The product was shipped in a timely manner...promised delivery was met. We are pleased with our shears and the shipping as well.
customer_reviews.author: R

customer_reviews.title: Work great
customer_reviews.text: I bought these after I misplaced a different pair of scissors. These are awesome for the price! They cut nicely, fit in my scrubs well, and the black looks sleek. Definitely recommend
customer_reviews.author: C. DeMers

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and reliable
customer_reviews.text: The shears are titanium, or that's at least what is engraved on them. The handles feel like abs plastic bit are durable enough. Great first aid shears.
customer_reviews.author: Jacob

customer_reviews.title: Scissor holes might be too big for small hands.
customer_reviews.text: I’m a nurse and I bought this for work. It looks larger than the regular bandage shears. Too big for my small hands. I was gonna return it to buy one that suits me better but there’s a shipping fee- my refund would only be $.96, so I guess I’ll just have to keep it.
customer_reviews.author: Her

customer_reviews.title: A must have for your scrub pockets
customer_reviews.text: I always have these in my scrubs at clinicals. Want to impress your instructor - keep one of these handy. I use them for opening all sorts of packages, cutting tight bands on socks, or opening stubborn pill packaging.
customer_reviews.author: NataliaG

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent shears, very durable and it doesn't feel like it'll fall apart. If you're in TEMS or have an IFAK that needs trauma shears then these are the ones you want to go for.
customer_reviews.author: Michael McCallister

customer_reviews.title: Bent
customer_reviews.text: It was an alright pair of scissors but the end that should be bent to protect skin while cutting clothes or bandages wasn't bent inwards at all or just barely so it stuck out horribly.
customer_reviews.author: Ache

customer_reviews.title: Great Scissors
customer_reviews.text: I've had these same scissors for years now. Great buy! No sharp edges so I've never cut myself but still cuts supplies really well. Still looks brand new. Great for nurse!
customer_reviews.author: Chi A.

customer_reviews.title: These are great for everyone
customer_reviews.text: These scissors/shears are sharp. I use them in the office, kitchen, garage. If you need to cut, these are your scissors.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph F. Gibbons Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Handy to have in the emergency kit
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to have in our cars emergency kits. I liked them so much I got one for the home medicine cabinet too.
customer_reviews.author: Annakatinka

customer_reviews.title: Great so far
customer_reviews.text: Bought for cutting lion fish while scuba diving, won’t be able to try until September but cuts anything else I’m trying like butter
customer_reviews.author: Krystal

customer_reviews.title: one was perfect. The other the blades are bowed away from ...
customer_reviews.text: Of the two scissors, one was perfect. The other the blades are bowed away from each other in the middle. So bought two, one is kinda useless in an emergency situation.
customer_reviews.author: RainFlash

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT CUT GOOD AT ALL
customer_reviews.text: I would like a refund. I am an emergency room nurse and the first time I went to use these scissors in a trauma they would not cut through clothing to get off of a patient. This slowed us in providing care and could have been dangerous. Please refund.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Large scissors
customer_reviews.text: These scissors are large in size. The handle is larger than what I expected. A bit disappointed but I didn’t read entire description. Not sure if these are going to be durable
customer_reviews.author: Kumba

customer_reviews.title: A little big
customer_reviews.text: If you're buying these as a nurse/nursing student, they don't fit in your scrub pockets. Not that they're advertised in that manner but just beware they are slightly large for that purpose. Other than that they have a nice matte black look to them which I admire.
customer_reviews.author: Brittney Burke

customer_reviews.title: Not sharp enough
customer_reviews.text: These are not as effective as described. Too dull for the intended (emergent and dependable) response that’s needed. They also felt more pliable than the replacement scissors I ordered. If sharpened and oiled they would be okay.
customer_reviews.author: KJ

customer_reviews.title: Fair price
customer_reviews.text: Worked great for about a year, now they are dull and need to be replaced. Price is fair for a year of use however
customer_reviews.author: Emily P.

customer_reviews.title: Works for me!
customer_reviews.text: I use these shears while grooming my milk cows. Some really don't appreciated having their tatas shaved with clippers. They tend to move a lot so there is no risk of poking them in the udder with a sharp tip. And I'm sure they do appreciate that in the long run!
customer_reviews.author: Valentine Running Brook

customer_reviews.title: Too big
customer_reviews.text: These are good scissors but they're too big for the pockets in my scrubs - they fall out regularly! They're much larger than they appear in the photo. Be sure to check the dimensions before buying!
customer_reviews.author: Illinois shopper

customer_reviews.title: Great price, large size
customer_reviews.text: Cutting edge is slightly serrated which is not apparent in pictures, but probably good for cutting off gauze or clothing. Finger openings are large enuf for a man's. Quite long overall (8" by my estimate). Good price.
customer_reviews.author: E'Beth

customer_reviews.title: Exactly as described; excellent product
customer_reviews.text: Does the job. Order arrived promptly and in good condition. Product works well and is as described. Great medical shears.
customer_reviews.author: maddox

customer_reviews.title: A must-have for hospital folks!
customer_reviews.text: Love these shears. I use them for work as I work in healthcare. Lightweight, sturdy, and easy to clean. Highly recommend. Make sure you personalize these shears because your coworkers will try to "borrow" them since they work so well :)
customer_reviews.author: Mrs. A C K

customer_reviews.title: Best bandage scissors!
customer_reviews.text: I had one other pair of these, and they managed to run off at the hospital where I was working. I thoroughly enjoy these scissors. And everyone else says they’re awesome, too. They’re strong, and durable, easy to clean, and they don’t feel cheap.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel Hatterick

customer_reviews.title: Great bandage scissors
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love these. They are bigger than I was picturing but they work better than any bandage scissors I've ever had. Would buy again!
customer_reviews.author: Julia Pickard

customer_reviews.title: Clunky scissors
customer_reviews.text: These scissors we thought were a tad smaller, they're a little bigger than we expected. At least theyre sharp (So far)
customer_reviews.author: k t

customer_reviews.title: Yep, they work.
customer_reviews.text: They work, they will cut a penny and get you naked fast enough. The black paint will come off if scraped, but they were pretty affordable, look cool and they do what they are suppose to. I feel comfortable having these on the rig with me.
customer_reviews.author: Sandee

customer_reviews.title: Best pair ive had!
customer_reviews.text: this has come in handy on more than one occasion. its great for cutting lots of things, from bandages to fiber glass splints to fit! amazing and still sharp to this day!
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan McPherson

customer_reviews.title: Bigger than my....nevermind
customer_reviews.text: These things are massive, heed the 7.25 inch warning, these bad boys will dwarf anything in their path, they really cut you down to size
customer_reviews.author: Ben

customer_reviews.title: Best scissors!
customer_reviews.text: FAVORITE WORK SCISSORS!!! Work so much better than any other bandage scissor I’ve tried. So worth it, I have like 3 pairs now LOL
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Haggerty

customer_reviews.title: Nope
customer_reviews.text: I ordered these to remove poultice bandages from my horses hoof and they simply weren’t up to the job. I had to order another brand of shears that did the trick. Cannot recommend this product if you have a heavy job.
customer_reviews.author: Stephnsea

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: The first time I used these, they would cut through the burn flat I needed. Ver disappointed. They even had some trouble completely cutting xeroform. Would not recommend for anything more than tape..
customer_reviews.author: Angel Taylor

customer_reviews.title: It Cuts!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for use in the field. Tested on clothing at home, it slices very easily. Black finish is nice touch as well to avoid reflecting light.
customer_reviews.author: R.Brad Zimmerman

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised
customer_reviews.text: Great medical bandage shears. Cuts easily, the blunted end protects your skin. Only defect was the exterior black coating was already wearing away, but that's just an esthetic drawback. Product is good.
customer_reviews.author: Bert Brandt

customer_reviews.title: Good quality, great for the price, durable.
customer_reviews.text: Great sturdy product, feels way better quality than the price would suggest, haven't had anything it can't cut through so far.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley Johnson

customer_reviews.title: 🧡
customer_reviews.text: Item as expected. Use them at the barn for my horse and his medical needs and I have a pair for work (Nurse).
customer_reviews.author: amy757

customer_reviews.title: Nice and served there purpose
customer_reviews.text: Good deal but doesn’t always cut the first time you might have to squeeze it a few times for it to completely cut through, but for the money they were absolutely worth it
customer_reviews.author: JOHN WARDLOW

customer_reviews.title: heavy great quality
customer_reviews.text: These scissors were bigger than I thought (my fault for not reading description fully) but they do a great job cutting through heavy jeans and bandages. I wouldn't trade them for any other kind. They're heavy duty tactical scissors. Great value for the money.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Every nurse needs these
customer_reviews.text: These are a must have for nurses. They are the best pair of bandage scissors I have ever purchased. Durable, precise while cutting bandages, and very comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Taija

customer_reviews.title: Best scisscor
customer_reviews.text: I work in the Emergency Department and use this scissor a lot. It cuts very well. I use it to cut splint materials as the scissor we have in the department just dull, and it cut well. I will say the best quality for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Martini

customer_reviews.title: Not a choice for projects
customer_reviews.text: I found these under Paracord shears when I was looking for a new pair. Too bulky, but worst of all they don’t give a clean cut, as far for Paracord anyway, always came out fraying or miss a piece.
customer_reviews.author: Manuel L Perez

customer_reviews.title: Sharp enough to cut through just about anything!
customer_reviews.text: Kept this available on my kit and have used this to cut through all sorts of stuff. Definitely worth snagging and great for all-purpose use!
customer_reviews.author: Ray B.

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: Great for cutting Coban 2 wraps with and other medical things I need it for
customer_reviews.author: Randall

customer_reviews.title: They Get the Job Done
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for something to cut non-woven gauze. I found these scissors and they get the job done.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole

customer_reviews.title: Nice Handle/Flawless Cut
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for work at a hospital. I work in the pharmacy and have to cut thick tubed plastic rings and zip ties. These cut beautifully! I recommend buying two....someone always needs to borrow a pair/easily get lost in a big hospital.
customer_reviews.author: Chelsea

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: Got these to do dressings on a horse's foot. Good size, big enough , light weight, does a good job. Hope they stay sharp awhile.
customer_reviews.author: HorseladyTop Contributor: Quilting

customer_reviews.title: Nice Cut
customer_reviews.text: These were very helpful while I was under home healthcare. Made taking my leg wrappings/bandages off easy and I was able to get a shower before the nurse arrived.
customer_reviews.author: JKW

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money
customer_reviews.text: They call them titanium but ruined them cutting about a 16 ga wire to get to a Pt. Plenty of better out there.
customer_reviews.author: Nathaniel Stephens

customer_reviews.title: Decent
customer_reviews.text: These might be left handed? I’m not sure. I’m a trauma operating room nurse so they do the job. Relatively sharp and cut through bandages, tape and tubing. Highly doubt they are titanium. They look nice though.
customer_reviews.author: Alison Bahnick

customer_reviews.title: Amazing!
customer_reviews.text: Cuts through it all! I do a lot of wound vacs and these slice through black sponge foam like butter!
customer_reviews.author: Amanda L. Halstead

customer_reviews.title: Two thumbs up
customer_reviews.text: Finally got to use these to cut off some clothes (I work in the ICU...they're usually past needing cut out of things by the time they get to me)! They worked beautifully, cut through multiple layers. They're kinda big, but I only keep two things in my pockets anyway, so no huge deal for me. I haven't tried to cut a penny or anything, but maybe someday...
customer_reviews.author: Emily

customer_reviews.title: Cuts una boots easily!!!
customer_reviews.text: If your a nurse you know hate cutting una boots off! These sheers are cheap and nice looking and will cut through una boots like butter.
customer_reviews.author: trey4u2

customer_reviews.title: Great for EMS, rescue and more
customer_reviews.text: Sharp edges, cuts very well. Definitely buying another soon. Bought two, for the truck and for my trauma kit. Great quality
customer_reviews.author: greengerm

product_meta.title: Ever Ready Titanium Bonded Bandage Shears 7 1/4" Bent, Tactical Stealth Black
product_meta.description: Package Quantity:1The Ever Ready 7 1/4" bandage shears have blades made of bonded TITANIUM, which is stronger than steel, a blunt tip for cutting material without damaging skin, a bent handle for cutting on surfaces. Tactical Black Stealth color! They are suitable for use by emergency room personnel, paramedics, nurses, and others to cut gauze, tape, clothing, bandages and other materials.
feature_bullets: Blunt-tip 7" shears for cutting gauze, tape, clothing, bandages, and other materials
Blades are made of bonded titanium, which is a lot stronger than steel
Suitable for use by emergency room personnel, paramedics, nurses, and others
Bent handle for cutting on surfaces
